bibl.title: From the Ptolemies to the Romans. Political and Economic Change in Egypt.
bibl.note: Expanded and revised version of a Ph.D., Stanford Univ., June 2008. - Part 1. Introduction: The political economy of Egypt; - Geography and population. - Part 2. The land-tenure regime: The regionalism of land-tenure; - The continuity of agrarian institutions. - Part 3. Fiscal and administrative reform: Land taxation and investment; - Administration and redistribution. - Part 4. The politics of economic change: The impact of empire; - Conclusion. - Bibliography. Index of sources. General index.
bibl.seg: Monson Andrew, From the Ptolemies to the Romans. Political and Economic Change in Egypt.
Cambridge, Cambridge University Press, 2012, 8°, xx-343 pp., 4 tabl., 1 carte, 14 figg. ISBN 978-1-107-01441-1. £60.

Expanded and revised version of a Ph.D., Stanford Univ., June 2008. - Part 1. Introduction: The political economy of Egypt; - Geography and population. - Part 2. Index of sources. General index.
